sub_topic: Preparation of p-nitroaniline from aniline and nitric acid
message_1: What is the ideal ratio of aniline to nitric acid to produce the maximum yield of p-nitroaniline in the preparation process?
message_2:
The ideal ratio of aniline to nitric acid to produce the maximum yield of p-nitroaniline in the preparation process is 1:1. This is because the balanced chemical equation for the nitration of aniline to form p-nitroaniline is:

C6H7N (aniline) + HNO3 (nitric acid) â†’ C6H6N2O2 (p-nitroaniline) + H2O (water)

As per the stoichiometry of the reaction, one mole of aniline reacts with one mole of nitric acid to produce one mole of p-nitroaniline. Therefore, the ideal molar ratio of aniline to nitric acid is 1:1 for maximum yield.
